column1: Data Supplied By: National Livestock Reporting Service
Data source: National Livestock Reporting Service
Please see terms of use here: https://www.mla.com.au/general/Terms-and-conditions/data-and-information/

Recent rain got the bids flying at the last Blackall weaner sale for 2024. Despite a mixed quality yarding of 3,500, including a line from the Northern Territory, good quality restocker steers and heifers saw a vast improvement on previous weeks with solid competition from local and south east buyer orders. 

A large number of light weight restocker steers in store condition were penned with the best steers under 280kg selling to 452.2c to average 418c, with ‘D’ muscle lines averaging 360c/kg. Buyers were still preferring steers 280 to 330kg with the top price of 444.2c to average 429c/kg. Medium steers returning to the paddock averaged 401c and good quality heavy feeder steers also improved, selling to 390.2c to average 379c/kg.

Northern restocker support helped push light weight restocker  heifers under 280kg out to 346.2c to average 319c while those heifers  280 to 330kg made to 330.2c to average 307c/kg. Feeders paid up to 320.2c for medium weight heifers averaging 283c, and a small sample of heavy feeder heifers made to 280.2 averaging 270c/kg.

Market reporter,
Sam Hart.
